page.title: 11Religion_St. Giles Church.
page.content: The existing church building is Victorian gothic in style. It was consecrated in 1867, replacing the previous building which it was said looked too much like a factory and has shown signs of rapid detoriation since its completion in 1750. The present vicar is the Rev. T. Newman who retires in November after 20 years of service. The church was dedicated to St. Giles a 7th. century hermit. The cruciform design of the church can hold 1000 worshippers and consists of a spacious nave and chancel, both with aisles, and north and south transcepts.
